WINTERTIME SUNDAY. WUOT uses this for student training; it would be a
better show for the audience if it were done by professional staff, of course.
£ or mat is a visit to someone’s house, that of the moderator, at which time
some four or feve intelligent, mature people read poems, essays, short stories,
articles, critical materials, and similar belle lettres to each other and thence
to the audience at home. Idea behind the show is to attempt to revive to some
extent the old-fashioned (?) idea of reading aloud for diversion. Naturally
some discussion of the material often comes in; sometimes this takes most of the
program and only one or two items are read. Program is carefully rehearsed for
interpretation, timing, style, etc.
SAFETY BEGINS BEFORE BREAKFAST. This program won the Sloan Highway Safety
Award for WUOT this year. Format is a breakfast table conversation between Mr.
and Mrs. John Qo Safety• No realism, of course; we know nobody would discuss
safety before .yforhji breakfast, and nobody would be named J. Q. Safety, either •
The dialogue iheavily spiced with humor of a fairly sophisticated kind, but the
actual Safety ideas are sound and serious, caning from the National Council and
state council. Success depdnds upon smart writing and professional acting of
well-paced, light comedy; but always remembering that the real purpose is to
communicate ideas for highway safety.
